Player History
Signed as a free agent by Los Angeles on 4/3/1985 to a 1-year deal worth $752,000 per year...
Had first career hit on 4/5/1985, off Frank Pastore (CIN)...
Hit first career homerun on 5/18/1985, off Mike Scott (PIT)...
Had 5 hits with 2 RBI against Atlanta on 7/6/1985...
Won Player of the Week award on 7/10/1985, hitting .579 with 0 HR, 5 RBI...
2/2/1987: Gets a new one-year contract worth $2,142,857 through salary arbitration...
Had 5 hits with 2 RBI against Chicago on 5/5/1987...
6/16/1987: Signed a contract extension with Los Angeles, $3,100,000 per year, for 3 years.
Injured on 8/3/1987 with a Torn Hamstring Muscle, out for entire career...
Had 21-game hitting streak snapped on 6/25/1988...
Won World Series with Los Angeles in 1988...
Drove in 6 runs against San Diego on 5/16/1990...
6/9/1990: Signed a contract extension with Los Angeles, $7,500,000 per year, for 3 years.
Released by Los Angeles on 7/20/1990...
Signed as a free agent by Boston on 7/20/1990 to a 1-year deal worth $952,000 per year...
Traded from Boston to Los Angeles on 7/20/1990 (Going to LAD: SS Ozzie Guillen. Going to BOS: 2B Eddy Diaz)...
Signed as a free agent by Los Angeles on 2/8/1991 to a 4-year deal worth $3,100,000 per year...
